article.headline: George Mason 96, McNeese State 63
article.story: FAIRFAX, Va. (AP)-- Mark Davis scored 19 points and Tony Skinn added a career-high 17 to lead George Mason to a 96-63 victory over McNeese State on Thursday night. Terry Reynolds finished with 14 points, six assists and four steals for the Patriots (5-2), who got another seven steals from Davis. Greg Tucker led McNeese State with 11 points. Monte Farmer had 10 points and seven blocked shots for the Cowboys (3-5), who have lost four in a row. Jai Lewis scored 12 points in 16 minutes for George Mason, and Richard Tynes added 10 points and five rebounds. The Patriots scored 31 points off the Cowboys' 28 turnovers. Raoul Heinen and Lewis scored four points each during George Mason's 10-2 run, and the Patriots took an 18-8 lead midway through the first half. Davis scored eight points in a 16-0 run by the Patriots late in the half. George Mason played without Lamar Butler, who averages 12.7 points. He is expected to miss at least three games with a left foot injury. The Patriots' only losses are to North Carolina and Maryland. <
